intro: Dorstenia rugosa, commonly known as the woolly stickleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that are covered in soft, white, woolly hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments. Dorstenia rugosa is also valued for its role in traditional medicine in some regions.
